brief_description: Costume designer Edie Kurzer applied the fake blood on this costume while the actor wore it so that it covered the fabric realistically and looked authentic.

constellations_primary.name: Blood, shot
constellations_primary.description: The fake blood used by costume designer Edie Kurzer in Judy & Punch is connected to a long, bloody lineage in cinema.

description: Lying on the floor is a bloodied double of Judy’s outfit. Costume designers don’t apply blood to the main version of the costume in case it needs to be used later. While the skirt on the left is made from a rare curtain from the period, this one is made from corduroy because it is seen less in the film. Fabrics aren’t the only important thing: the colour of the blood is too, and it needs to be tested to make sure it looks real on film. It’s also applied to the costume while the actor wears it, because it falls differently whether they’re standing or sitting.
